In this internsip a systematic study of L-rhamnosylation was done to design a valuable method to implement in glycovaccines. The influence of protective groups, reactivity, solvents and glycosylation method, i.e. catalytic vs. promoted glycosylation, are studied. It is found that the selectivity can be controlled to a large extend, by varying these parameter and hence the same donor can give both anomers. A reversal of the influence of participating solvents is observed and hence ethereal solvents increase the β selectivity, whereas nitrile solvents give almost exclusive α selectively.

1) Elferink, H.; Pedersen, C. M.
